item.title: Lqgend Has Officially Joined Vancouver Surge in the Call of Duty League
item.content:encoded:
Lqgend, who was most recently an active competitor in Halo esports and ascended to win the Halo World Championship in 2024 with Spacestation, has officially merged into the Call of Duty League. He follows a transitional path that many other CDL competitors have, but it has been a very long time since a Halo world champion wound up in the top-tier Call of Duty esports space.

One of the most notable competitors to walk that path before Lqgend was Shotzzy, OpTic Texasâ€™ frontman and one of just two esports pro players in history to win a world championship title in two games.

Will Lqgend be the third?

From Sci-fi to Sci-fi

Itâ€™s an appropriate time for Lqgend to merge into the Call of Duty League, given that the 2026 season will play out on Black Ops 7, a near-future game with some Halo-like mechanics. Itâ€™s a natural transition, and in recent weeks, Lqgend has already proven his Call of Duty talent in scrims and streams.

The 22-year-old French player has enjoyed a rapid rise to fame in the Halo space, but now that Halo Infiniteâ€™s esports structure has all but finished, heâ€™s ready to make that all-important move.

The all-new Surge roster was uncovered hours ago, and it contains mostly young and fresh players keen on cutting their teeth in the Call of Duty League this coming season.

Last season, Vancouver Surge had a stunning run, but couldnâ€™t close out a tournament. The team wound up in second place numerous times, including at the Call of Duty League Championship in Canada, falling in second against a dominant OpTic Texas.

Do you think Lqgend will go far in the Call of Duty League? Let me know what youâ€™re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Gumayusi Departs T1 Esports After Winning LoL Worlds
item.content:encoded:
T1 Esports has confirmed the departure of Lee â€˜Gumayusiâ€™ Min-hyeong, closing the book on a seven-year chapter that saw the team secure three consecutive League of Legends World Championship titles, including the 2025 win that came mere days ago.

While Choi â€˜Zeusâ€™ Woo-jeâ€™s controversial exit in 2024 left T1 fans stunned, Gumayusiâ€™s decision to depart feels different, given that it has come very early in the off-season and coincides with the expiration of his contract with T1.

Gumayusi Goes Into the Open

T1â€™s recent announcement regarding Gumayusiâ€™s departure from the roster was loaded with gratitude and respect for all the player has given the organization over the last few years. It was confirmed that the choice to leave the team was â€˜his alone.â€™

Despite his MVP-winning performance at Worlds 2025, Gumayusi had a trying 2025 leading up to the monumental win. Earlier this season, the competitor was benched, and T1 only just managed to scrape up a qualification to Worlds. The tough year and cracks showing in the foundations might have pushed Gumayusi to seek pastures new.

Speculation is now swirling like wildfire in the League of Legends esports space. Gumayusiâ€™s next home could be under the Hanwha Life banner, or it could be assuming a spot with Gen.Gâ€™s roster, changes pending.

In social circles, rumors have already begun circulating about Gumayusiâ€™s replacement. T1 appears to be wasting no time in filling that spot, and suggestions have emerged that Kim â€˜Peyzâ€™ Su-hwan could join the squad in place of Gumayusi.

Wherever he winds up, Gumayusi will be an asset to every roster he sits within.

Where do you think Gumayusi is headed? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server what your pick would be.

item.title: Rebecca Heineman, Co-Founder of Interplay, Has Passed Away
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday, the unfortunate news broke that Rebecca Heineman, co-founder of Interplay, Logicware, Contraband Entertainment, and Olde SkÃ¼Ã¼l, and the first national United States esports champion, had passed away. Following a battle with aggressive lung cancer, Heineman was recently hospitalized and given days to live.

As a pioneer in the games industry for women in development, video game archival, and lifetime creator of some of the most influential video games, Heineman leaves behind a stunning legacy.

Generational Run

In 1980, Rebecca Heineman traveled to Los Angeles to attend an enormous Space Invaders championship event, hosted on the Atari 2600. Not expecting to get anywhere close to the top spot, Heinemen unexpectedly won the entire event, going on to later win a second championship in New York.

That made Heineman the United Statesâ€™ first national esports champion.

As young as 16, Heineman was diving deep into coding, creating games and software at a time when concepts were just being framed. She co-founded Interplay Productions in 1983, a legendary studio that would go on to create Baldurâ€™s Gate, The Bardâ€™s Tale, Wasteland, and, probably most importantly, Fallout.

Heineman was rumored to be one of the last people in possession of the source code for the original Fallout game, released in 1997.

Her career took her through some of the most prolific companies in gaming, from Electronic Arts and Ubisoft to Microsoft and Sony, and she was a stalwart advocate for LGBTQ+ representation in the industry.

In a post on a GoFundMe page set up to help with medical costs, Heineman explained her story:

How did this start? I noticed when I was at PAX prime that I was out of breath climbing a single flight of stairs. When I got back to Dallas, I went to the emergency room and they found I had 2300ml of fluid in my lung cavity (see photos). They drained another 1600ml a week later. After cat scans, X-rays, and blood tests they finally found that the cancer is in my lungs and liver.

Yesterday, a final post was shared, along with a last image:

Itâ€™s time. According to my doctors. All further treatments are pointless. So, please donate so my kids can create a funeral worthy of my keyboard, Pixelbreaker! So I can make a worthy entrance for reuniting with my one true love, Jennell Jaquays.

Heineman, who predominantly went by the nickname â€˜Burgerâ€™ for two decades, leaves behind five children.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Could Come to Switch 2, Itâ€™s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
In a recent post on social media, a rumor has once again surfaced that Grand Theft Auto 6 could arrive on Nintendo Switch 2 after it has launched on other major platforms. This rumor was partially backed up by NateTheHate, who confirmed hearing that Rockstar was â€˜doing tests to bring it to Switch 2â€™.

If Rockstar Games could optimize the hell out of Grand Theft Auto 6, it could be the biggest game to ever land on a Nintendo platform, alongside the likes of Cyberpunk 2077 and The Witcher 3.

Is GTA 6 Coming to Switch 2?

In a post on social media, user â€˜Nash Weedleâ€™ published a claim that GTA 6 is actively in the works for Nintendo Switch 2:

I can CONFIRM that a GTA VI port for SWITCH 2 is in the works. I havenâ€™t said much about it; I had to be cautious until now. I can also comment that: â€“ The gameâ€™s delay isnâ€™t due to this version. â€“ It doesnâ€™t seem like it will be a launch title.

Nash has a decent track record when it comes to Nintendo leaks and insider tidbits.

NateTheHate, another notable insider, was summoned to the post to offer his two cents, and he confirmed that Rockstar Games was at least testing bringing GTA 6 to Switch 2:

I said a while ago that R* was doing tests to bring it to Switch 2; but tests donâ€™t always equal release. I know an effort has been made to see if they can bring it to the platform. I donâ€™t know the current state of that effort.

It wouldnâ€™t be the first Grand Theft Auto game to wind up on a Nintendo platform, but it would by far be the biggest. In recent years, the remastered GTA Trilogy landed on Switch, but Grand Theft Auto 5 always eluded the platform.

Itâ€™s believed that GTA 6 could technically run on the Switch 2, but with some major performance downgrades, such as a lower frame rate, reduced visual fidelity, and tapered resolution. It certainly wouldnâ€™t offer anything close to the performance of a PlayStation 5 or an Xbox Series X, for example.

If GTA 6 comes to Nintendo Switch 2, could you see yourself buying it? Let me know what youâ€™re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Take-Twoâ€™s CEO says gaming is â€˜moving towards PCsâ€™

item.title: Take-Two CEO Says Gaming â€˜is Moving Towards PCsâ€™
item.content:encoded:
In an interview with CNBC, Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick had some comments regarding the console/PC debate. In fact, it seems heâ€™s taken a side in the whole debacle.

The divide between PC and console gaming has been a rather long one. Exclusives on one, better quality on the other, it all seems to go back and forth. Take-Two, known for publishing the Grand Theft Auto and NBA 2K, has been on both fronts. Every month, it seems the company finds itself on the best-selling list for consoles for its catalog of sports games. While itâ€™ll take a while for the company to see a bigger pay day with Grand Theft Auto 6 delayed, it seems the CEO has some thoughts on the console/PC divide.

Zelnick Says â€œBusiness is Moving Towards Openâ€ to PC in Recent Interview

Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick sat down with CNBCâ€™s Squawk Box for an interview on gaming. While on the topic of console gaming, Zelnick stated,

â€œI think itâ€™s moving towards PC and business is moving towards open rather than closed,â€ says Zelnick. â€œBut if you define console as the property, not the system, then the notion of a very rich game that you engage in for many hours that you play on a big screen â€” thatâ€™s never going away.â€

His comments do come at a convenient time, as Valve announced the upcoming console, the Steam Machine, which can play Steam games on your TV. Similarly, Xbox and Microsoft have veered a bit towards PC gamers, as recent statements from figures in the company indicate a change in tone from consoles. Weirdly, Take-Twoâ€™s biggest upcoming release, Grand Theft Auto 6, has not been announced for PC. Its last entry, Grand Theft Auto 5, didnâ€™t see a PC release until two years after launching in 2013. In any case, it seems the company may be gearing to open up with PC gaming more than ever.

What do you think of Zelnickâ€™s comments? Do you think PC is the way to go? Or is console better? Do you think GTA 6 is going to PC? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Take-Two news, check out our articles on Borderlands 4â€™s sales and stock plummet after GTA 6 delay. Donâ€™t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Silent Hill Townfall Release Date Possibly Leaked
item.content:encoded:
According to a storefront leak, Silent Hill Townfall is coming in early 2026. Furthermore, even before weâ€™ve seen gameplay, we know when itâ€™s releasing.

Announced all the way back in 2022, Silent Hill Townfall is a collaboration between Konami and Annapurna Interactive. Not much is known about the project outside of a cryptic announcement video from the Silent Hill Transmission presentation. Many had a bad feeling the project wouldnâ€™t see the light of day, as the series hadnâ€™t been doing well, and the Annapurna layoffs. However, right at the prime of the franchise, with Silent Hill 2 Remake and Silent Hill f being massive successes, it seems itâ€™s not too far off.

Silent Hill Townfall Possibly Releasing March 26, 2026, According to Storefront Leak

The leak in question comes from e-shop Liverpool Mexico, which showed Silent Hill Townfall and a release date of March 26, 2026. Unfortunately, the listing in question has since been deleted, though Polish outlet CD Action managed to screenshot it beforehand. Prominent Silent Hill figure Rachel Ashmun also credited the listing on Twitter/X, lending a bit more leverage to it.

Itâ€™s important to note that Konami and Annapurna have not released anything official yet regarding Silent Hill Townfall, so take the leak with a grain of salt. Still, the timing does come at a mighty convenient time. On November 20th, Xbox is holding a Partner Preview at 10 am PT/1 pm EST. One of the games heavily rumored, and even leaked, for the presentation is Silent Hill 2 Remake. The title, helmed by Bloober Team, is a timed PlayStation exclusive that, if true, will come to Xbox Series X|S on November 21st. Perhaps we may get a double feature for Silent Hill then? Weâ€™ll have to wait and see!

What do you think of the Silent Hill Townfall release date leak? Think itâ€™s true? Excited to see the title after years of waiting? Whatâ€™s your favorite Silent Hill game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Silent Hill, check out our articles on Silent Hill fâ€™s latest update and Silent Hill 1 Remake. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Breaks Record at The Game Awards 2025
item.content:encoded:
Sandfall Interactiveâ€™s Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has broken a very impressive record following The Game Awards 2025 nominations. The game, nominated for Game of the Year, leads a stellar list of other contenders, including Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 and Hollow Knight Silksong.

Releasing earlier this year, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 blew many out of the water. Not only did it look gorgeous for an indie game, but the turn-based RPG combat felt reminiscent of classic Final Fantasy and Persona. It quickly became 2025â€™s best-reviewed title for a time before Hades 2 overtook it a month ago. Still, it was pretty clear the game would make an appearance at The Game Awards in big categories. However, its nominations prove itâ€™s showing up in a huge way, more than any other year.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Gets Record 12 Nominations at The Game Awards 2025

The Game Awards 2025 announced its nominees today (you can find the whole list here) and it had some bombshells. Perhaps the biggest of all was Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. The indie title managed to snag a record-breaking 12 nominations, including three in one category. Previously, the record holders were 2020â€™s The Last of Us Part 2 and 2023â€™s God of War: Ragnarok, which each had 11 nominations. The full list of nominations for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 can be found below:

  • Game of the Year
  • Best Game Direction â€“ Sandfall Interactive
  • Best Narrative
  • Best Art Direction
  • Best Score and Music
  • Best Audio Design
  • Best Performance
    • Ben Starr as Verso
    • Charlie Cox as Gustave
    • Jennifer English as Maelle
  • Best Independent Game
  • Best Debut Indie Game
  • Best Role-Playing Game

Meanwhile, Sony Interactive Entertainment got 19 nominations, as its titles Death Stranding 2: On The Beach and Ghost of Yotei both went big. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 joins Death Stranding 2: On The Beach, Kingdom Come Deliverance 2, Hollow Knight Silksong, Donkey Kong Bananza, and Hades 2 for Game of the Year. Either way, weâ€™ll find out who takes home the title on December 11th when The Game Awards 2025 goes live.

What do you think of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33â€™s record nominations? Is it deserving of it? Is it your Game of the Year? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more RPGs, check out our articles on the most influential and Final Fantasy 9â€™s remake. Donâ€™t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
